item.title: Dead by Daylight adds Nicolas Cage as a playable Survivor with acting-related powers | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Behaviour Interactive Can Nicolas Cage act his way out of a bodybag? As promised, Nicolas Cage (Renfield, Pig) is now a playable character in Dead by Daylight, Behaviour Interactive‚Äôs venerab...
item.content:encoded: Image: Behaviour Interactive Can Nicolas Cage act his way out of a bodybag? As promised, Nicolas Cage (Renfield, Pig) is now a playable character in Dead by Daylight, Behaviour Interactive‚Äôs venerable multiplayer survival horror game pitting Survivors against Killers. He‚Äôs bringing the power of acting to the game‚Äôs realm of terror, known as the Fog. Cage is now a selectable character in Dead by Daylight‚Äôs public test build through Steam, which will launch fully in late July. In the new DLC, Ca...

item.title: Get three months of Game Pass Ultimate for $24 before tomorrow‚Äôs price hike | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Microsoft / Xbox Going once, going twice... Today is your last opportunity to stock up on Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions before the price increase on July 6, raising the monthly price from ...
item.content:encoded: Image: Microsoft / Xbox Going once, going twice... Today is your last opportunity to stock up on Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions before the price increase on July 6, raising the monthly price from $14.99 to $16.99. Game Pass has always been an excellent value, offering access to a rotating library of AAA titles to play on your PC or Xbox, and day one access to new releases like Starfield. Some of the most recent additions to the Game Pass library include the Warioware-like McPixel 3, socialis...

item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo via Polygon Nintendo hands out some in-game items, while curtailing your ability to duplicate them Nintendo released a new patch for The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom on Tuesday, rolling out a number of fixes to bugs that blocked progression for some players and prevented fairies from appearing. But the latest update for Tears of the Kingdom ‚Äî version 1.2.0 ‚Äî also addresses some bugs that were advantageous to players. Yes, Nintendo appears to have cracked d...

item.content:encoded: Image: IllFonic/Gun Media If you have to go, this is one way to do it Friday the 13th: The Game will be pulled from sale at the end of 2023, as publisher Gun Media‚Äôs license for the venerable slasher movie series is set to expire. But ‚Äî beyond an already-announced price cut ‚Äî the developers have a treat in store for their remaining players, starting Thursday: Everybody gets everything. The developers announced on Twitter that all players of the asymmetrical multiplayer game ‚Äî which pits slashe...

item.title: Grand Theft Auto 5 comes back to Xbox Game Pass in July | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Image: Rockstar Games Plus two day-and-date launches: Exoprimal and Techtonica Grand Theft Auto 5 returned to Xbox Game Pass on Wednesday to kick off the next month of titles coming to subscribers. ...
item.content:encoded: Image: Rockstar Games Plus two day-and-date launches: Exoprimal and Techtonica Grand Theft Auto 5 returned to Xbox Game Pass on Wednesday to kick off the next month of titles coming to subscribers. Others on the way include Capcom‚Äôs dinosaur-shootin‚Äô Exoprimal, and Double Fine‚Äôs 2013 adventure The Cave. GTA 5 had been available on Xbox Game Pass from April to August 2021, and before that from January to May 2020. Like those first two runs, Rockstar‚Äôs open-world crime epic is only available to ...

item.description: Photo: Abhishek Lamba and Zain Memon The progressive nonprofit organization celebrates its 20th anniversary this year Games for Change, the leading voice for video games that promote positive social...
item.content:encoded: Photo: Abhishek Lamba and Zain Memon The progressive nonprofit organization celebrates its 20th anniversary this year Games for Change, the leading voice for video games that promote positive social change, spent the last few years just like the rest of us ‚Äî getting way into board games and tabletop RPGs. The nonprofit marks its 20th anniversary this July, and to celebrate, it will give out the inaugural Best Board or Tabletop Game for Impact award at its marquee Games for Change Festival in N...

item.title: Indiana Jones: Sands of Adventure turns Raiders of the Lost Ark into a raucous party game | Polygon - Gaming
item.description: Photo: James Paul Correia Photography/Funko Games No monkeys were harmed in the making of this game There‚Äôs a moment in every Indiana Jones movie where a fight breaks out and things rapidly spiral o...
item.content:encoded: Photo: James Paul Correia Photography/Funko Games No monkeys were harmed in the making of this game There‚Äôs a moment in every Indiana Jones movie where a fight breaks out and things rapidly spiral out of control. Perhaps a man with a large sword stands in the way of finding Indy‚Äôs companion. Maybe a clean getaway in a minecart turns into a deadly chase. Or perhaps a dogfight with a Messerschmitt becomes a crash landing when someone accidentally shoots out the tail of the biplane. Whatever the ...

item.content:encoded: Image: Nintendo EPD/Nintendo Can you spare a scrap of gravitas? I love a good villain. Heroes save the day, but antagonists are often the ones who drive the plot forward. While Link and Zelda are reacting to Ganon‚Äôs plots, he gets to go wild unleashing things like the Calamity and the Upheaval. But having the same big bad gets a little stale, and Ganondorf is truly the most prolific boss in all of the Zelda games, only occasionally yielding ground to a secondary antagonist, like Zant. Which is...

item.title: How to Build a Streaming Semi-structured Analytics Platform on Snowflake | KDnuggets
item.description: Building a datalake for semi-structured data or json has always been challenging. Imagine if the json documents are streaming or continuously flowing from healthcare vendors then we need a robust mode...
item.content:encoded: Building a datalake for semi-structured data or json has always been challenging. Imagine if the json documents are streaming or continuously flowing from healthcare vendors then we need a robust modern architecture that can deal with such a high volume. At the same time analytics layer also needs to be created so as to generate value from it.

item.description: Jon Bennett and I have just uploaded to the arXiv our paper ‚ÄúAdjoint Brascamp-Lieb inequalities‚Äú. In this paper, we observe that the family of multilinear inequalities known as the Brascamp-Lieb inequ...
item.content:encoded: Jon Bennett and I have just uploaded to the arXiv our paper ‚ÄúAdjoint Brascamp-Lieb inequalities‚Äú. In this paper, we observe that the family of multilinear inequalities known as the Brascamp-Lieb inequalities (or Holder-Brascamp-Lieb inequalities) admit an adjoint formulation, and explore the theory of these adjoint inequalities and some of their consequences. To motivate matters let [‚Ä¶]

item.content:encoded: Posted by Fabian Pedregosa and Eleni Triantafillou, Research Scientists, Google Deep learning has recently driven tremendous progress in a wide array of applications, ranging from realistic image generation and impressive retrieval systems to language models that can hold human-like conversations. While this progress is very exciting, the widespread use of deep neural network models requires caution: as guided by Google‚Äôs AI Principles, we seek to develop AI technologies responsibly by unde...

item.title: On-device diffusion plugins for conditioned text-to-image generation | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Yang Zhao and Tingbo Hou, Software Engineers, Core ML In recent years, diffusion models have shown great success in text-to-image generation, achieving high image quality, improved infer...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Yang Zhao and Tingbo Hou, Software Engineers, Core ML In recent years, diffusion models have shown great success in text-to-image generation, achieving high image quality, improved inference performance, and expanding our creative inspiration. Nevertheless, it is still challenging to efficiently control the generation, especially with conditions that are difficult to describe with text. Today, we announce MediaPipe diffusion plugins, which enable controllable text-to-image gener...

item.title: Unifying image-caption and image-classification datasets with prefix conditioning | Google AI Blog
item.description: Posted by Kuniaki Saito, Student Researcher, Cloud AI Team, and Kihyuk Sohn, Research Scientist, Perception Team Pre-training visual language (VL) models on web-scale image-caption datasets has re...
item.content:encoded: Posted by Kuniaki Saito, Student Researcher, Cloud AI Team, and Kihyuk Sohn, Research Scientist, Perception Team Pre-training visual language (VL) models on web-scale image-caption datasets has recently emerged as a powerful alternative to traditional pre-training on image classification data. Image-caption datasets are considered to be more ‚Äúopen-domain‚Äù because they contain broader scene types and vocabulary words, which result in models with strong performance in few- and zero-shot recogn...

From Theory to Practice: Building a k-Nearest Neighbors Classifier | KDnuggets
item.description: The k-Nearest Neighbors Classifier is a machine learning algorithm that assigns a new data point to the most common class among its k closest neighbors. In this tutorial, you will learn the basic step...
item.content:encoded: The k-Nearest Neighbors Classifier is a machine learning algorithm that assigns a new data point to the most common class among its k closest neighbors. In this tutorial, you will learn the basic steps of building and applying this classifier in Python.

item.title: Evolution of the Data Landscape | KDnuggets
item.description: The article follows the story of evolution in the data space through the lens of evolutionary patterns. It talks of the state of significant milestones in the evolutionary journey, their achievements,...
item.content:encoded: The article follows the story of evolution in the data space through the lens of evolutionary patterns. It talks of the state of significant milestones in the evolutionary journey, their achievements, challenges, and the next milestone that solved those challenges. The article comes from both a business and technical perspective, owing to the persona of the authors.

item.description: Have you ever wondered how fortune tellers, astrologers, or our well-known Baba Vanga used to predict future events? Or have you ever questioned whether AI and ML have the capabilities to predict futu...
item.content:encoded: Have you ever wondered how fortune tellers, astrologers, or our well-known Baba Vanga used to predict future events? Or have you ever questioned whether AI and ML have the capabilities to predict future events as Baba Vanga did? For suppose if AI and ML have the capabilities, then up to how extent can it predict? I am writing this to give answers to these types of questions.

item.content:encoded: Posted by Ramki Gummadi, Software Engineer, Google and Kevin Chen, Software Engineer, YouTube Caching is a ubiquitous idea in computer science that significantly improves the performance of storage and retrieval systems by storing a subset of popular items closer to the client based on request patterns. An important algorithmic piece of cache management is the decision policy used for dynamically updating the set of items being stored, which has been extensively optimized over several decad...

item.content:encoded: Posted by Zal√°n Borsos, Research Software Engineer, and Marco Tagliasacchi, Senior Staff Research Scientist, Google Research The recent progress in generative AI unlocked the possibility of creating new content in several different domains, including text, vision and audio. These models often rely on the fact that raw data is first converted to a compressed format as a sequence of tokens. In the case of audio, neural audio codecs (e.g., SoundStream or EnCodec) can efficiently compress wav...
